awd_titl_txt: A Study of Minority Science and Engineering Doctorate       Recipients Who Began Their College Careers as Non-          Traditional Students
awd_abstract_narration: This proposed project addresses a very important educational               issue and a major NSF concern (minorities in the science and                    mathematics pipeline).  The topic of non-traditional paths to                   science and mathematics doctorates needs to be studied                          systematically, and the proposed project represents a good first                step in that direction.  The national data base analysis and                    interviews with minority doctorate recipients should be                         illuminating.  Ideally, they will spawn hypotheses that will serve              as the foundation for more non-doctoral minority personnel who work             in science/mathematics areas in corporations or the military also               have potential to yield some important findings.//
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
